channel.title: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet
channel.description:
I get an error when running my JAR from a webpage.
This is the error thrown in the Java console: [CODE]java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.lang.RuntimePermission exitVM.0) [/CODE]
I have googled it and I understand what is wrong. I am just having trouble figuring out why it won't work. I changed [CODE]setDefaultCloseOperation(javax.swing.WindowConstants.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);[/CODE]
To:
[CODE] setDefaultCloseOperation(javax.swing.WindowConstants.DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE); [/CODE]
But the same error is still thrown..
Any help is appreciated.

item.title: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Moparisthebest:

It’s been a long, long time, but I think I add everything to a JPanel, and use that JPanel to either a frame or the applet depending on how it is ran. Anyway, that is a good way to do it.

Yeah, I agree.

Nice and simple, easy to develop,

Read full topic

It’s been a long, long time, but I think I add everything to a JPanel, and use that JPanel to either a frame or the applet depending on how it is ran. Anyway, that is a good way to do it.

item.source: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet

item.title: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:277085”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=365752.msg2774728#msg2774728 date=1241466655]
No amount of superficial tinkering is going to get a Desktop application to run as an Applet. You’re going to need to port it if you want it to be displayed in a web page.
[/quote]

That isn’t really true, if you program it right it will run as both, that is how moparscape works, in a webpage it runs as an applet, or it can run as an application as well.[/quote]

Because you wrote all of it as an applet, and in order to run on the desktop you just stick it in a frame. =P

Read full topic
item.source: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet

item.title: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:277085”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=365752.msg2774728#msg2774728 date=1241466655]
No amount of superficial tinkering is going to get a Desktop application to run as an Applet. You’re going to need to port it if you want it to be displayed in a web page.
[/quote]

That isn’t really true, if you program it right it will run as both, that is how moparscape works, in a webpage it runs as an applet, or it can run as an application as well.[/quote]

Well, yes, but then it’s no longer strictly a Desktop application - it’s a hybrid.

Read full topic

That isn’t really true, if you program it right it will run as both, that is how moparscape works, in a webpage it runs as an applet, or it can run as an application as well.

item.title: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Is this signed or unsigned?

Signed.[quote=“Ollie, post:5, topic:277085”]Open up DOS/Shell type policytool
add a runtime permission
& target as the JVM
save the file with extension .pol

now run the applet using the following:
appletviewer -J-Djava.seurity.policy=“filename.pol” appletfilename[/quote]

O.K., I’ll try that.

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:6, topic:277085”]My guess is that since you bothered to set the default close operation, in the first place, you’re trying to run a Desktop application instead of an Applet.

Are you using JApplet to display swing components?[/quote]

Desktop application

Read full topic
item.source: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet

item.title: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

My guess is that since you bothered to set the default close operation, in the first place, you’re trying to run a Desktop application instead of an Applet.

Are you using JApplet to display swing components?

Read full topic

item.title: JAR Security Error when ran from Internet
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Open up DOS/Shell type policytool
add a runtime permission
& target as the JVM
save the file with extension .pol

now run the applet using the following:
appletviewer -J-Djava.seurity.policy=“filename.pol” appletfilename

Read full topic
